segments.text: Add 2 tablespoons of chia seeds into a
small bowl. Pour in four tablespoons of
water. Give it a gentle stir and set it
aside. By the way, I'd love to know
where are you watching from. Drop your
country's name or flag in the comments.
While that thickens, measure 150 g of
flax seeds. Blend them into a fine soft
powder. Ground flax seeds bring in that
subtle nutty flavor that makes the dough
smell warm and earthy. When you grind
them fresh, they release all their
omega-3 goodness. Those healthy fats
that keep your heart strong and your
brain sharp. They're also packed with
lignens and fiber, which help balance
hormones, support digestion, and keep
you feeling full for longer. It's one of
those quiet superfoods, simple, natural,
and so good for your body inside and
out. That gentle nuttiness will give
your bread a rich flavor and a soft,
moist texture without needing any flour
or oil. Add one teaspoon of baking
powder
and a pinch of salt.
Mix everything well. If you haven't
subscribed to our channel yet, make sure
to hit that subscribe button so you
don't miss any of our upcoming healthy
and delicious videos. Even if you've
never baked bread before, trust me, this
one's different. It's simple, foolproof,
and gives you that perfect golden
gluten-free loaf on your very first try.
No needing, no stress.
Now, pour in 3/4 cup, about 200 ml, of
water. Stir until it starts forming a
smooth, sticky dough. When you grind
flax seeds, something really cool
happens. They turn into this natural
magic powder that loves water. The
moment you mix it in, it starts soaking
up all the liquid and thickens into a
soft, sticky dough. That's because flax
is full of natural fiber that acts like
a sponge. It holds everything together,
keeps the bread moist, and gives it that
perfect texture. No flour, no eggs, just
the power of seeds doing their thing.
Now add the chia gel. That chia gel
brings everything together, gives the
dough a nice bounce, and helps it stay
soft and moist inside. They might look
small, but chia seeds are powerhouse
ingredients. Soothing for digestion and
amazing for sustained energy.
Look how it thickens naturally without
any flour or eggs. Next, toast 50 g of
sunflower seeds in a dry pan. Keep them
moving until they turn golden and
release that warm, nutty aroma.
Add the toasted sunflower seeds to the
mixture. Give it a gentle stir so they
spread evenly through the dough.
Now set it aside and let it rest for
about 15 minutes. During this time, the
seeds absorb moisture and the dough
starts to firm up beautifully.
Line your baking dish with parchment
paper. Lightly brush it with oil,
making sure to cover the sides as well.
You'll notice the texture becoming
thicker and easier to shape. That's
exactly what we want. Now, take the
dough and form it into a smooth ball.
Make sure the surface looks even and
neat.
Drizzle one teaspoon of apple cider
vinegar or white vinegar over the top
and spread it evenly.
After that, place the shaped dough into
your prepared dish.
Sprinkle a bit of sesame on top for that
final touch.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350° F for
about 60 to 70 minutes until the crust
turns golden and your kitchen smells
incredible. While it bakes, let's make a
quick fresh dip. Add 2 tablespoon of
Greek yogurt into a bowl. Finally, chop
a few leaves of sorrel, spinach, or some
spring onions.
and and mix them in.
Add one tablespoon of olive oil, a
teaspoon of lemon juice, a pinch of
salt,
and one crushed clove of garlic.
Stir until creamy and smooth. It's
tangy, refreshing, and full of good
fats.
Now, back to our bread. Look at that.
Golden on top, firm on the outside, and
soft inside. Let it cool for a few
minutes before slicing.
So, here it is. A beautiful golden
gluten-free vegan bread that's
flowerless, wholesome, and full of life.
From the first slice to the last, it's
everything you'd want in a healthy
homemade bread. Soft, hearty, and packed
with flavor. You can taste the seeds,
the care, and the simplicity in every
bite. It's more than a recipe. It's a
reminder that good food doesn't have to
be complicated.
This plant-based loaf gives steady
energy, warmth, and comfort. Perfect for
breakfast, lunch, or anytime you crave
something real. Once you try this
flowerless bread, you'll see how easy
healthy baking can be. No gluten, no
eggs, no processed ingredients, just
pure natural goodness. If this bread
inspired you to cook with more love and
simplicity, please like this video. It's
a small gesture that helps in a big way.
Share it with someone who'd appreciate a
little homemade comfort and remind them
that healthy food can still be full of
flavor and joy. Every time you share,
this community of mindful eaters grows
stronger. And of course, don't forget to
subscribe. Thanks for being with us.
Wishing you all good health and lots of
joy. Bonapetit. Be sure to check out our
other videos featuring a variety of
healthy and tasty oat flatbreads that
are very popular.
[Music]
[Music]
[Music]
